intro: Carumbium platyneuron, commonly known as the silverleaf nightshade, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and potatoes. The plant is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in the evening. Its fruits are berries that contain toxic compounds, making them harmful to humans and livestock. Due to its ornamental value and toxic properties, it is often found in gardens and wild areas.
